Posts.Content: jessica57 wrote: Just finished my 2nd treatment with A/C last week and now I swear I have the flu! Don't know if this is from the Decadron, chemo or I really do have the flu. I understand that the chemo will make me feel rundown for a few days but sinus headaches aches and fluish feeling? I don't get it.  Is there someone out there who has had my symptoms? Dx 10/17/2012, IDC, Stage II, Grade 3, 1/3 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 11/19/2012 Lumpectomy: Right; Lymph node removal: Right, Sentinel Chemotherapy 1/17/2013 AC + T (Taxol) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: A/C or the flu? jessica57 jessica57

Posts.Content: Apr 26, 2013 05:34PM jessica57 wrote: Hi anyone and everyone.  I had my 4 treatments of A/C. Now I'm on my 3rd treatment of Taxol.  That didn't go over very well because I had moderate allergic reactions to it.  Not very pleasant.  Have to meet with the onco dr on Monday to determine the course of action.  Has anyone ever experienced an allergic reaction to taxol and does anyone know what other chemo drug they might try and what the SE will be with the next type of drug.  Very discouraged right now because I thought all was well with the taxol. The first 2 treatments were at a slow drip so I handled it very well until the 3rd time when they tried me at the normal drip.  That obviously didn't go over very well with my body!  HELP!!!!
